FuncDef: This command assigns a Distributed CPU Protection (DCP) policy to the network interface. Only a valid created DCP policy can be assigned to a network interface (this rule does not apply to templates such as an msap-policy).

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the name of the DCP policy up to 32 characters in length.

ExtraInfo: Default: If no dist-cpu-protection policy is assigned to the VPRN network interface, then the default network DCP policy (_default-network-policy) is used. If no DCP functionality is required on the VPRN network interface then an empty DCP policy can be created and explicitly assigned to the VPRN network interface.
